title: Can No Longer Be a Secondary Support Player
body:
I've always considered myself an ADC main, and a secondary support player. I love the bot lane.
Now, however, I play support 9 games out of 10 because of the dynamic queue. 
Let it be clear that _I do like the idea of the dynamic queue._ That being said, I'm sick & tired of **not** getting my primary role **more often** than I do. ESPECIALLY when your secondary role is support. 

Please, if any Riot employee could address if they are aware of this issue and if they are considering doing anything about it, it'd be much appreciated!




EDIT: A lot of people are focusing on just the support aspect of this post. My main point is that you should get your primary role the majority of the time, regardless of your secondary role. Perhaps 60-40 would be a good, reasonable ratio.

The system with regard to support specifically just doesn't work as intended at all. It's funny, it worked OK in the first few days because people were actually using "fill", but no longer - everyone learned their lesson. Here are the problems:

1. **The "Fill" role _IS _"Support".** There is literally no difference between the two buttons. Both result in you getting Support.
2. **You cannot choose support (or fill) as your "second option".** Doing so will result in you playing your first option 0% of the time. The last 50 games I played were all support because I want to play Jungle primarily and Support secondarily. That's what I want to do, and so that's what I select, and yet I play nothing but support.

**SOLUTIONS**

**Solution**: _Force some weighted randomization between the roles chosen._ So if I say I want Jungle | Support, then when I do, roll an RNG that's like 60% Jungle, 40% Support. Don't tell the player which one got chosen, but if it chose Jungle, now you just sit and wait until a Jungle spot opens. This is a pretty good solution in my opinion. Wait times go up a bit, but players have an experience similar to what they would expect from your system.

**Bad solution**: _Own it._ This would involve deleting "fill" as an option and making it so that if you make Support as a secondary or primary option, you can not select any other options. Basically this would be Riot essentially admitting that no one wants to play Support.

**Solution**: _Provide IP rewards for playing roles that are less popular._  This is also kind of bad because you're similarly acknowledging that you have roles that people don't want to play, but it might be a good stop-gap for the next thing.

**Great, hard solution**: _Make support something people actually want to play._ This would be a huge project, but I would say you can start by deleting all of this extra fanfare regarding getting kills. Delete the "multi kill" shit. When you have this giant banner that comes on the screen saying PENTAKILL, it sends a clear signal that the game is really all about getting kills. In fact, it is not about getting kills at all. The team with fewer kills can and sometimes does win. So by putting focus on kills - something support shouldn't be doing - you're basically telling your audience that support is a lame role to play.

I feel pretty confident that Riot will do something about this - it's pretty obviously not working properly - but looking forward to seeing what they specifically do.

It feels like support is the job where the most boring thing is the best thing. I want to play support and feel like I passed the ball to someone for the winning shot, or stuffed a shot in basketball. Its that no one plays support because it is the job IN A VIDEO **_GAME_** where having the least fun is the best option.

> As far as anybody knows dynamic queue is working exactly as intended, so I'm not sure what you're talking about.

They intended for you to get the role you selected as "Secondary" just as often, or more often, than the role you selected as "Primary?" I think not. 
Granted, this may only be a problem with the support role. Judging by a lot of these comments, though, it is not. 
I don't think it's too much to ask for getting your selected primary role the majority of the time.

It is working exactly as intended. Few people queue up for support.
So what happens is this:
4 players queue up, filling every role except support. A minute passes, and someone queues up as Mid/Support. Oh look, someone who will play support to fill this team out.
Then it happens again.
I think the issue of getting your secondary multiple times in a row is due to this type of issue. Your primary/secondary choices are not weighted against each other at all if there is a team that has been in queue waiting for a role you have selected.

Judging by many of these comments, people are getting their secondary role just as often, or more often, as their primary role regardless of what combination of roles they selected. 
Well put, though. I think you are most definitely correct in the process of the issue.
The stage where you pick your role, that IS the dynamic queue I though, no? Again, my only point I was trying to make is that you should get your Primary Role the majority of the time. That is all.
